授業目的: Students will be introduced to rhetorical patterns: description, comparison and contrast, and opinion, and they will have the opportunity to write an essay.
到達目標: Students will acquire the ability to employ writing strategies to write an essay that is supported by facts.

第1回: 1.Class requirements; organization of a paragraph: ethics in writing; journal assignment
Write a journal about yourself; review topic sentences and controlling ideas (pages: 5-7)
第2回: 2.Unit 1: Organization of an essay: introduction, body paragraphs, conclusion; review topic sentences and supporting ideas.
第3回: 3.Unit 1: How to write a thesis statement: topic and controlling idea of the entire essay; parts of the introduction: hook, background information, and thesis statement
第4回: 4.Unit 2: Descriptive essays; using adjectives: formation and order; mind map for organizing ideas
第5回: 5.Unit 2: Descriptive essays: prepositional phrases in descriptive writing; adding details
第6回: 6.Unit 4: Comparison essays: similarities & differences/ paraphrasing; final essay requirements
Explore themes for final essay; complete page 88, section B on organization of comparison essay
第7回: 7.Unit 4: Comparison essays: using connectors to compare and contrast; final essay topic due
Complete page 99; start research for final essay; study for quiz
第8回: 8.Quiz; Unit 5: Opinion essays: fact vs. opinion; analyzing viewpoints
Review in textbook or online how to combine facts with opinions; write draft of final essay
第9回: 9.Opinion essays: introduction, topic sentences/supporting ideas task; final essay draft #1 due
Research for supporting facts for final essay
第10回: 10.Opinion essays: useful vocabulary, connectors and transitions; paraphrasing; how to cite sources
Following rubric and comments for improvements on first draft, rewrite your essay and add to it.
第11回: 11.Opinion essays: counterargument; grammar points and paraphrase practice; essay draft #2 due
第12回: 12.Common errors in opinion essays: strategy instruction: the conclusion; final essay edits
Based on instructor and peer edits, revise your final essay
第13回: 13.Final essay due; review of essay patterns: descriptive, comparison-contrast, and opinion
